Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அருமறை சோரும் அறிவிலான் செய்யும்பெருமிறை தானே தனக்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The fool who neglects precious counsel does, of his own accord, a great injury to himself.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An ignorant person ('அறிவிலான்') is being given a precious, rare secret or piece of advice ('அருமறை'), visualized as a glowing, intricate key.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Due to their carelessness, they let this precious key slip through their fingers ('சோரும்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The key falls and locks a massive, heavy iron door that slams shut in front of them. The door represents a great and self-inflicted torment or imprisonment ('பெருமிறை'). Their own negligence has created their prison.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The ignorant person who carelessly lets slip a rare piece of wisdom is, by that very act, inflicting a great and inescapable torment upon themselves.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The rare advice as a precious key is the central object. The act of letting it slip and thus locking oneself in prison is the key narrative. The imprisonment is self-inflicted.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The key glows with a precious, hopeful light. As it is dropped, the scene becomes dark and claustrophobic as the iron door slams shut, plunging the fool into darkness.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that follows the falling key and ends on the final, resounding slam of the great iron door.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A dramatic shift from a moment of opportunity (the glowing key) to a state of imprisonment (darkness).
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Dark fantasy, with a strong symbolic message.

Cultural_Anchors: Letting slip a rare secret ('அருமறை சோரும்')
